data.enText: the spreading of a disease by people touching each other
There is no risk of contagion.
a disease that can be spread by people touching each other
something bad that spreads quickly by being passed from person to person
data.chText: （不良事物的快速）传播，蔓延，扩散

tr: the communication of an attitude or emotional state among a number of people
example: the infection of his enthusiasm for poetry

tr: an incident in which an infectious disease is transmitted
any disease easily transmitted by contact

example.ex: They have been reluctant to admit AIDS patients, in part because of unfounded fears of contagion...
example.tran: 他们一直不愿接纳艾滋病患者，部分原因是无来由地害怕被接触传染。

example.ex: I'm a blood donor; I can't risk any contagion.
example.tran: 我是献血者，我不能冒任何接触传染的危险。

value.def: Contagion is the spreading of a particular disease by someone touching another person who is already affected by the disease.

example.ex: He continues to insulate his country from the contagion of foreign ideas.
example.tran: 他继续使本国远离外来思想的侵袭。

value.def: You can use contagion to refer to the spreading of ideas, or attitudes, or feelings that you consider to be bad or unacceptable from one group of people to another.
value.tran: (不良思想、态度、感情等的)传播，蔓延
